marketNews.title: BP and partner invest $8.5 billion in carbon capture and Ubadari gas field development
marketNews.content: Oil and gas producer BP and its partner will invest $8.5 billion in a carbon capture project and the development of the Ubadari gas field in West Papua. BP CEO Murray Auchincloss said the gas field development could add about 3 trillion cubic feet of gas resources. Production from the field is expected to start in 2028.

marketNews.title: Japan government signs 21.9 trillion yen stimulus package
marketNews.content: The Japanese government signed an economic stimulus worth 21.9 trillion yen (approximately $140 billion) on Friday (22/11) to support consumer purchasing power amid the worst election results for the ruling coalition in 15 years. The package includes assistance of about 30,000 yen for low-income households, fuel and energy subsidies, and support for small businesses. The overall business impact of the incentive is estimated at 39 trillion yen. The government says the incentive aims to ensure a transition to a growth-oriented economy driven by wage increases and investment.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia reports M2 growth of 6.7% YoY in October 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that broad money (M2) in October 2024 grew 6.7% year-on-year to 9,078.6 trillion rupiah (versus September 2024: 7.2% YoY). The increase was driven by narrow money (M1) growth of 7.1% YoY and quasi-money growth of 4.2% YoY. M2 development in October was mainly affected by a -0.1% YoY contraction in net government receivables (versus September 2024: +12.3% YoY), while credit disbursement remained stable at +10.4% YoY. Net foreign assets grew 1.6% YoY in October 2024 (versus September 2024: -0.3% YoY).

marketNews.title: International Criminal Court issues arrest warrants for Israeli leaders and Hamas commander
marketNews.content: Judges at the International Criminal Court released arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and former Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, as well as Hamas commander Mohammed Deif. The ICC stated the three individuals are suspected of war crimes in the Israel-Palestine conflict. Israel says Deif was killed in an air strike in Gaza in July 2024.

marketNews.title: Setyo Budiyanto elected KPK chair for 2024-2029
marketNews.content: Chief of Police Setyo Budiyanto was officially elected as Chairman of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) for the 2024-2029 period on Thursday (21/11). Setyo is an active three-star police general, most recently serving as Inspector General of the Ministry of Agriculture. Following the election, anti-corruption NGO Transparency International Indonesia urged Setyo to resign from the police to avoid conflict of interest.

marketNews.title: META seeks extension of voluntary tender offer
marketNews.content: The CEO of Nusantara Infrastructure (META), M. Ramdani Basri, said that the controlling shareholder, PT Metro Pacific Tollways Indonesia Services, has applied to the OJK for an extension of the voluntary tender offer period. The move is due to 6,110 META shareholders who have not participated in the tender as of 30 September 2024. META had previously conducted two voluntary tender periods as part of its go-private plan.

marketNews.title: DRMA commissioner Noel Aelyo purchases 500,000 shares
marketNews.content: DRMA commissioner Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara bought 500,000 DRMA shares at an average price of 1,065 rupiah per share on 19 November 2024. The transaction value was about 532 million rupiah. After the transaction, Noel’s ownership in DRMA increased from 1.38% to 1.4%.

tickerNews.title: NCKL 9M24: Net profit +8.4% YoY, beats expectations
tickerNews.content: NCKL 9M24: Net profit increased 8.4% year-on-year, surpassing expectations. Trimegah Bangun Persada (NCKL) recorded its highest quarterly net profit since IPO in 3Q24, with realization of 2 trillion rupiah (+12.6% quarter-on-quarter, +18.2% year-on-year). This result brought net profit for the first nine months of 2024 to 4.8 trillion rupiah (+8.4% YoY), beating expectations as it equals 93%/91% of the FY24 Stockbit/consensus estimate. Operationally, revenue in 3Q24 grew 11.9% QoQ while cost of goods sold rose more moderately (+3.7% QoQ), leading to gross margin improvement to 37.5% (vs. 2Q24: 32.6%). In addition, operating expenses fell 7.3% QoQ, driving operating profit growth of 35.5% QoQ. Quarterly margin improvement was driven by: 1) higher limonite sales as the HPAL smelter owned by the company's subsidiary PT Obi Nickel Cobalt started operating; and 2) higher ferronickel (FeNi) selling price. Volume of limonite ore sales increased 69.3% QoQ, 103.2% YoY in 3Q24, driven by the start of operations of the HPAL smelter of PT Obi Nickel Cobalt in August 2024. The sales are not eliminated because NCKL's ownership in PT Obi Nickel Cobalt is only 10%. Volume of FeNi production was relatively stable (-1.8% QoQ, +3.0% YoY) in 3Q24, with sales volume rising (+2.5% QoQ, +3.6% YoY). FeNi selling price was US$11,921 per ton (+4.8% QoQ, -7.7% YoY), with cash cost of US$8,353 per ton (+3.7% QoQ, -9.8% YoY). In the earnings call on Friday (22/11), management announced that the company started producing electrolytic cobalt – a derivative of mixed hydroxide precipitate (MHP) – with capacity of 6,000 tons per year and began exporting in August 2024. This product sells at a higher price of US$22,047 per ton (vs. cobalt sulfate US$17,031 per ton) with a lower cash cost of US$8,308 per ton (vs. cobalt sulfate US$9,020 per ton) for 9M24. Electrolytic cobalt also has the same conversion ratio as MHP to cobalt sulfate. Key takeaway: management expects 4Q24 operational performance to be relatively stable compared with 3Q24, and therefore we assess that FY24 and FY25 performance estimates should be revised upward. On the day’s trading, NCKL shares rose 3.09% to 835 rupiah per share. Based on existing estimates, NCKL trades at a forward 1-year P/E of 8.02x, below its historical average of 8.4x.

tickerNews.title: PACK changes business activity, plans rights issue, targets revenue of Rp5 trillion
tickerNews.content: PACK: Digital packaging solutions announced it will rename the company to Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama and change its business activity to a holding company in the nickel trading sector. PACK estimates that the business activity change will increase sales to about 5.3 trillion rupiah in 2025, with net profit around 346 billion rupiah. PACK also plans a rights issue of up to 100 billion new shares, with the execution price to be announced later; the proceeds will be used for capital expenditures and working capital. These corporate actions will be discussed at the extraordinary general shareholders meeting on 30 December 2024.

tickerNews.title: BBYB rumor of divestment by Akulaku denied
tickerNews.content: BBYB: Kontan reported that the Akulaku group, through PT Akulaku Silvrr Indonesia and/or Rockcore Financial Technology Co. Ltd., attempted to offer a partial divestment of Bank Neo Commerce shares to the founder of the Barito group, Prajogo Pangestu. However, Prajogo’s son and Barito Pacific CEO, Agus Salim Pangestu, told Kontan that the rumor was false. The rumor appeared amid Akulaku’s plan to reduce its ownership in BBYB from 39.95% to a maximum of 30%, which was approved in the extraordinary general shareholders meeting on 15 November 2024.

tickerNews.title: SMRA marketing sales 515.3 billion rupiah in October 2024
tickerNews.content: SMRA: Summarecon Agung recorded marketing sales of 515.3 billion rupiah in October 2024, up 69% month-on-month and 93% year-on-year. This brought 10-month marketing sales to approximately 3.2 trillion rupiah, down 5% YoY, achieving 64% of the 2024 target of 5 trillion rupiah. The residential segment contributed 74% of the 10-month marketing sales, followed by shophouses (14%), apartments (6%), land parcels (5%) and office/commercial (1%). Specifically, residential marketing sales in October 2024 reached 435.9 billion rupiah, the highest level of the year.

tickerNews.title: FILM shareholder Tencent sells 251.6 million shares
tickerNews.content: FILM: Shareholder of MD Entertainment, Image Frame Investment (HK) Limited (Tencent), sold 251.6 million FILM shares at an average price of 1,200 rupiah per share on 12 November 2024. The total transaction value was about 302 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Image Frame Investment’s ownership in FILM fell from 14.05% to 11.51%.

tickerNews.title: MINA shareholder Hapsoro buys 243.8 million shares
tickerNews.content: MINA: Shareholder Sanurhasta Mitra, Hapsoro, bought approximately 243.8 million MINA shares at an average price of 23 rupiah per share on 20 November 2024. The total transaction value was 5.6 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Hapsoro will become the new controlling shareholder of MINA with a direct ownership of 5.73% and an indirect ownership through PT Basis Utama Prima of 45.71%. Consequently, Hapsoro will make a mandatory tender offer for the remaining MINA shares.

tickerNews.title: BMRI director buys 472,500 shares
tickerNews.content: BMRI: Bank Mandiri director Agus Dwi Handaya purchased 472,500 BMRI shares at an average price of 6,350 rupiah per share on 15 November 2024. The total transaction value was about 3 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Handaya’s ownership in BMRI increased from 0.0114% to 0.0119%.

tickerNews.title: TSPC interim dividend 112.7 billion rupiah
tickerNews.content: TSPC: Tempo Scan Pacific will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to 112.7 billion rupiah, or 25 rupiah per share. The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 2 December 2024, with payment on 19 December 2024. Based on TSPC’s closing price on Friday (22/11) at 2,570 rupiah per share, the implied dividend yield is 1%.

tickerNews.title: IMAS shareholder sells 55 million shares
tickerNews.content: IMAS: Shareholder of Indomobil Sukses Internasional, PT Sejahtera Raya Perkasa, sold 55 million IMAS shares at an average price of 652 rupiah per share on 8 November 2024. The total transaction value was about 35.9 billion rupiah and was intended as a reverse repo. After the transaction, PT Sejahtera Raya Perkasa’s ownership in IMAS fell from 10.10% to 8.72%.
